intro: Elatostema paucicystatum, commonly known as the small-cysted elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky outcrops. Elatostema paucicystatum has a short stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
